result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Deavila was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: the sentence in case #14CM5196.

Concurrent to the probation ordered in case #14CM5169.

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs and surcharges (including DNA and any domestic violence surcharge); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant is advised he may never possess a firearm.
No contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention programming.
Complete any assessments such a AODA and mental health that are deemed appropriate by the department.
Take any medication as prescribed.
Participate in any counseling that is recommended.
Absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Phillip Deavila in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Phillip Deavila in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to the sentence in case #14CM5196.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation, concurrent to the probation ordered in case #14CM5169.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 30 days condition time imposed and stayed.
- Provide a DNA sample.
-Successfully complete Batterers Intervention programming.
-Complete any assessments such a AODA and mental health that are deemed appropriate by the department.
-Take any medication as prescribed.
-Participate in any counseling that is recommended.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs and surcharges (including DNA and any domestic violence surcharge); 
All applicable fees of supervision.


Defendant is advised that he many never possess a firearm.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  
Victim Impact Statement

Court orders defendant referred to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, Defendant to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No firearms/dangerous weapons. Comply with no Contact order.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to report by 3:00 PM on 6/18/2015.

Defendant Phillip Deavila in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appearing in court, the court VACATED the bench warrant. Discussion regarding Justice Point and complying with bail conditions. Attorney Rosenthal requested case be adjourned for Sentencing to allow for global resolution with case 14CM5169. Defense counsel needs to be appointed this matter. Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal previously in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT in court.  
JUDGE KUHNMUENCH FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Case set for Calendar Call date.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered stay lifted on the Bench Warrant and or it to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED JUDGE Pending Sentencing. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT in court. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case called to address Justice Point VIOLATION Report. Defendant failed to report to Justice Point. Discussion regarding violation. Court ordered a Bench Warrant, but STAYED issuance for a Calendar Call date in branch 23.  Calendar call scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM022821  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/01/2015

Defendant Phillip Deavila in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Status Conference. Parties have reached a resolution of this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Carlene S

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
